intro: Orthosiphon debilis, commonly known as small-leaved spirea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Orthosiphon debilis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
